Package jrtr

Class VertexData

  • java.lang.Object
    • jrtr.VertexData
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GLVertexData, SWVertexData
    public abstract class VertexData
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides functionality to specify 3D geometry in the form of triangle meshes. VertexData consists of a list of VertexData.VertexElements. It is an abstract class, use the implementation GLVertexData or SWVertexData which should be instantiated via RenderContext.makeVertexData(int).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  VertexData.Semantic
      Vertex data semantic can be position, normal, texture or color coordinates.
      class  VertexData.VertexElement
      A vertex element is an array of floats that stores vertex attributes, like positions, normals, or texture coordinates.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private int[] indices
      Indices into the vertex data (vertexElements) to specify the triangles (i.e., the first three indices define the three vertices of the first triangle, the second three indices the second triangle, etc.).
      private int n
      The number of vertices
      private java.util.LinkedList<VertexData.VertexElement> vertexElements
      A list of the vertex elements to store the vertex attributes.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Vertex data consists of a list of vertex elements, and an index array.

    • Constructor Detail

      • VertexData

        public VertexData​(int n)
        Vertex data consists of a list of vertex elements, and an index array. The index array contains indices into the vertex data. The indices specify how vertices are connected to triangles. I.e., the first three indices define the three vertices of the first triangle, the second three indices the second triangle, etc.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of vertices.
